summary:
Republika Srpska is a region in Bosnia and Herzegovina, mainly in the north and east. It was created in 1992 during the Bosnian War to protect the Serbian people. The war caused many non-Serbs to leave this area. The largest city is Banja Luka.

It has its own government, with 83 representatives in the National Assembly. Republika Srpska is home to most of the country's Serbian population. It is divided into 64 local areas called municipalities.
title: Republika Srpska
